intro: Erodium heterosepalum, commonly known as the variable erodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often lobed or toothed. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. Erodium heterosepalum is part of the Geraniaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
